subject: Horse Racing
lead_paragraph: The jockey Rafael Bejarano was thrown headfirst to the ground in a spill during the eighth race at Santa Anita in California. He was unseated when his mount Parisian Art apparently had a fatal heart attack inside the eighth pole. Bejarano had eased the 3-year-old gelding to the back of the 12-horse field when Parisian Art suddenly dropped to the ground and Bejarano fell off. Bejarano, a 25-year-old Peruvian, is Santa Anita’s leading rider with 60 wins at the winter meeting. He led the nation’s jockeys in 2004 with 455 wins.
